PRE-K and KINDERGARTEN ROUNDUP at EISD

June 17 & 18
9am-3pm in the School Foyer

Please bring:
1. Official Birth Certificate
2. Immunization Record
3. Social Security Card
4. Parent's Picture ID

Pre-K eligibility will be determined upon review of all documents received. Eligibility notifications will be sent via email by July 15.

Students who attended Pre-K at Evant ISD last year WILL need to attend to complete new paperwork for kindergarten registration for the 2020-21 school year.

For more information, email sparrish@evantisd.org or jingram@evantisd.org.

Evant ISD is proud to welcome Principal Howard Cox and his wife Tracy to the Elk Family! Mr. Cox will officially begin his duties as PK-12 Principal this summer. He has served Hamilton ISD as a teacher and coach for the last 13 years, but he is now looking forward to wearing the black and gold!!! We are very excited to have the Cox’s on our team!

Current Principal, Jennifer Ingram, will remain in Evant ISD as she transitions to a new role as Director of Finance and School Improvement. Mrs. Ingram will oversee district school improvement processes as well as PK-12 curriculum & instruction and she will also assume the role and responsibilities of current Business Manager, Danny Hemphill.

Mr. Hemphill will be retiring at the end of this school year after serving Evant ISD for the last 14 years in varying capacities including Campus Principal and Business Manager. He is looking forward to spending more time on the ranch with his grandchildren after retirement!

Without a single question or complaint, they are jumping in to help students and help each other in whatever way they can - and for that, I am so grateful! Our kids are in the best hands - so THANK YOU TEACHERS & STAFF, you guys ROCK!!!! We appreciate you all so much! I’m super proud to be an Evant Elk!
Love you all,
Mrs. Ingram

EVANT ISD...Extended Closure

Given the rapidly evolving situation with COVID-19, Evant.ISD, and Little Elks Early Learning Center will extend the school closure through Friday, March 27th, in an effort to support our nation's need to slow the spread of the Coronavirus. Suspending operations for this length of time, will allow us to determine, in coordination with local health authorities, whether the virus is continuing to spread, or whether it has been contained. We will have school packet pick up and return on Monday, March 23rd in order to continue to provide education to our students during these trying times. Thank You for All your support.
God Bless

Given the rapidly evolving situation with COVID-19, Evant.ISD, and Little Elks Early Learning Center will extend the school closure through Friday, March 27th, in an effort to support our nation's need to slow the spread of the Coronavirus. Suspending operations for this length of time, will allow us to determine, in coordination with local health authorities, whether the virus is continuing to spread, or whether it has been contained. We will have school packet pick up and return on Monday, March 23rd in order to continue to provide education to our students during these trying times. Please watch Facebook for additional details on how we will run packet return/pickup on Monday.

Thank You for All your support.
God Bless

Jose Erasmo Morales Vasquez, age 41, of Evant passed away suddenly and unexpectedly on Dec. 29, 2019 leaving behind a wife and 4 young children ranging from 7-16 years old. Jose was the sole provider for his family. Cherokee Athletic Booster Club will be hosting a silent cake auction during our home Junior High and High School games against Evant on 1/20/2020 and 1/21/2020. Bidding will end at half time of the boys games and winners will be announced. All proceeds from the auction will go to help the Morales family during this difficult time. Please come out and cheer on the Indians to victory and help show Evant what true Indian Pride looks like.
